title: MODERN FARMING EQUIPMENT NEW TECHNOLOGY SPECIAL

tasks.task: Unloading the hay from the vehicle into the barn.
subtasks: Driving the vehicle carrying hay to the barn.
Parking the vehicle near the entrance of the barn.
Opening the vehicle's rear gate or door.
Removing hay from the vehicle, either by hand or using a shovel.
Transporting the hay from the vehicle to designated areas in the barn.
Stacking or arranging the hay in the barn according to storage requirements.

tasks.task: Attaching a trailer to a tractor and operating it for moving hay.
subtasks: Preparing the tractor by checking fuel, oil, and belts.
Placing the tractor in gear and driving it to the location of the trailer.
Hooking up the trailer to the back of the tractor using the drawbar.
Ensuring the trailer is secure and properly attached.
Starting the tractor and trailer, then driving to the hay field or storage area.
Detaching the trailer from the tractor and unloading hay either manually or using the trailer.
Reattaching the trailer to the tractor and driving it to the barn.
Unloading the trailer following steps similar to when using the vehicle.

tasks.task: Operating a forklift to stack hay in the barn.
subtasks: Approaching the forklift and operating the controls to raise the forks.
Entering the hay into the forks, lifting it off the vehicle or pile.
Navigating the forklift to the hay storage area within the barn.
Lowering the forks to deposit the hay in the desired location.
Repeating the process multiple times for efficient stacking.

tasks.task: Marking hay stacks with flags or paint.
subtasks: Choosing a location or stack to mark.
Selecting a flag or paint marker.
Climbing onto the hay stack or using a ladder to reach the top.
Applying the flag or paint to the stack for identification.
Writing or attaching labels if using paint or markers.

tasks.task: Tidellocking a tractor and trailer for stability.
subtasks: Placing the tractor in parking gear.
Engaging the parking brake.
Ensuring the trailer is anchored or braked separately.
Using chocks or wedges under the wheels for added security.
Applying weight to the trailer lashings if necessary.

tasks.task: Driving a piece of farming equipment such as a grain combine through a field.
subtasks: Starting the combine and performing pre-checks.
Adjusting the settings on the combine to suit the crop being harvested.
Entering the field at a safe speed, observing for any obstacles.
Operator controls to cut and collect the crop.
Transporting the harvested crop to a storage or processing area.

tasks.task: Checking the fuel level in a farm vehicle.
subtasks: Approaching the vehicle and locating the fuel gauge or dipstick.
Reading the current fuel level or pulling out the dipstick.
Comparing to the required level or checking for adequate fuel.

tasks.task: Helping someone jumpstart a farming equipment engine.
subtasks: Locating the jumper cables or an external power source.
Connecting the positive clamp to the battery terminal, then negative to a metal surface away from the battery.
Starting the functioning vehicle first, then the equipment engine after connecting.
Disconnecting the cables in reverse order once the engine starts.

tasks.task: Propping open a sliding barn door manually.
subtasks: Identifying the barn door needing assistance.
Locating the mechanism or area where the door jams or rubs.
Using a wedge or piece of wood to撑住 the door open.
Ensuring the door remains open for use.

tasks.task: Loading hay into a trailer using a tractor.
subtasks: Positioning the trailer near the hay source.
Connecting the trailer to the tractor's drawbar.
Moving the tractor to collect hay, either by raking or direct loading.
Loading hay onto the trailer with a pitch fork or loader attachment.
Securing the hay on the trailer to prevent shifting during transport.

tasks.task: Walking a dog specifically bred for farm work.
subtasks: Leading the dog through the fields or barn area.
Using commands or a leash to direct the dog's movements.
Ensuring the dog does not enter dangerous areas or chase livestock.
Providing supervision and companionship for the farm's working dog.

tasks.task: Fixing a fence at the bottom of a hill to prevent soil erosion.
subtasks: Removing any existing damaged posts or panels.
Driving new fence posts into the ground along the hill's contour.
Attaching wire or panels to the new posts, ensuring posts are straight and tight.
Staggering posts to prevent runoff channels from cutting through the fence.
Checking the integrity of the fence once completed to ensure it will hold up against soil movement.

tasks.task: Checking the band on a baler to ensure it's tight.
subtasks: Accessing the baler, typically from the front or side.
Locate the banding mechanism or the part that holds the hay together.
Inspecting the tension of the banding material for evenness around the bale.
Tightening the band if necessary by adjusting the tension rollers or screw.
Rewinding the band onto the spool correctly if tangled.

tasks.task: Changing a flat tire on a farm tractor.
subtasks: Moving the tractor to a flat, stable surface if possible.
Loosening the lug nuts with a wrench before jacking up the vehicle.
Jacking up the tractor to remove the flat tire.
Removing the lug nuts and taking off the flat tire.
Mounting the spare tire, aligning it correctly.
Tightening the lug nuts by hand, then torque-wrenching them if available.
Lowering the tractor back to the ground.
Checking the tire's inflation and securing the jack and tools.

tasks.task: Cleaning out the barn stalls after animals have been moved.
subtasks: Separating the manure and bedding from the unused area.
Using shovels or pitchforks to collect the manure and bedding.
Hauling the materials either to a storage pile, compost area, or spreading location.
Washing down the stalls with water or cleaning solution.
Refilling the stalls with fresh bedding if needed.

tasks.task: Operating a grain auger to transfer grain from the field to a truck.
subtasks: Aligning the auger extension with the grain blower on the tractor or combine.
Starting the auger and directing grain flow through the extension.
Connecting the auger to the receiving hopper or grain box of the truck.
Monitoring the flow to prevent overfilling and ensuring proper attachment.
Loading the truck to the desired capacity, stopping when full.
Detaching the auger and covering the truck if necessary.

tasks.task: Checking and maintaining the drawbar connection between tractor and trailer.
subtasks: Inspecting the drawbar for any wear or damage.
Cleaning debris or dirt from the area around the drawbar.
Ensuring the drawbar pin and safety链锁 are secure andtightened.
Testing the connection by attempting to rock the trailer while attached.

tasks.task: Setting up a portable shade structure for livestock in a barn.
subtasks: Measuring the space where the shade will go.
Unfolding the shade structure and positioning it properly.
Ensuring it's anchored or secure against wind.
Adjusting height or angle as needed for optimal shade coverage.

tasks.task: Handling a spool of bailing twine to operate a baler.
subtasks: Approaching the baler and attaching the twine to the take-up reel.
Ensuring the twine is securely fastened and spool is properly placed.
Keeping tension on the twine while feeding it into the baling mechanism.
Adjusting speed or tension as necessary based on the bale size.

tasks.task: Performing preventative maintenance on a combine harvester.
subtasks: Checking oil and coolant levels.
Inspecting belts and replacing any worn or damaged ones.
Greasing moving parts and adjusting lubrication points.
Testing controls and hydraulic systems for proper function.
Cleaning filters and replacing if needed.

tasks.task: Using a skid steer loader to load hay onto a trailer.
subtasks: Attaching a hay fork or scoop to the skid steer's bucket.
Positioning the loader arm to pick up the hay bales.
Carefully lifting the bales onto the trailer, ensuring they don't fall.
Arranging the bales on the trailer for stability during transport.

tasks.task: Assisting in the calving process of a dairy cow.
subtasks: Observing the cow for signs of labor and impending birth.
Preparing a clean, comfortable area for the calf to be born.
Helping to position the cow during delivery if necessary.
Cutting the umbilical cord, cleaning the calf, and ensuring it is breathing.
Providing milk immediately or contacting a veterinarian if needed.

tasks.task: Operating a grain dryer and prover to dry and cool grain.
subtasks: Feeding grain into the dryer hopper or bin.
Starting the drying process and monitoring temperature and humidity levels.
Regulating airflow and heat settings to desired moisture levels.
Once dried, moving the grain into the prover for cooling.
Adjusting the cooling fan speed and duration based on grain temperature.
Testing sample grains for moisture content upon completion.

tasks.task: Planning and implementing a rotational grazing schedule for cattle.
subtasks: Dividing the pasture into several paddocks.
Setting up electric fencing or moveable panels to manage rotation.
Monitoring grass regrowth and adjusting rotation times.
Moving livestock from one paddock to another at optimal times.
Ensuring each paddock is rested and growing before re-grazing.

tasks.task: Applying seed to a field using a no-till drill or planter.
subtasks: Checking and preparing the drill or planter for operation.
Calibration of seed rates and depths.
Driving through the field in straight lines, adjusting depth and speed as needed.
Ensuring proper cover and seed-to-soil contact.
Periodic checks for clogged discs or planter units.

tasks.task: Draining a section of a waterway to prevent erosion.
subtasks: Assessing the area where drainage is needed.
Removing excess vegetation and debris from the waterway.
Excavating the waterway to desired depth using a shovel or tiller.
Leveling the bottom and sides to ensure proper water flow.
Installing drainage tiles or grading the land to direct water flow.

tasks.task: Using a disc harrow to break up compacted soil.
subtasks: Selecting the appropriate disc depth for the soil condition.
Attaching the disc harrow to the tractor and adjusting hydraulics.
Driving the tractor at a suitable speed over the compacted area.
Monitoring the depth and evenness of soil disruption.
Checking for any rutting or clumps that require further work.

tasks.task: Inspecting the condition of a grain storage bin or silo.
subtasks: Ascending to the top of the bin or silo using a ladder or platform.
Observing for unusual bulges, leaks, or damage externaly.
Taking samples from various spots within the bin for moisture and quality checks.
Checking for pests or mold growth signs inside the bin.
Verifying aeration systems and their functionality.

tasks.task: Checking tire pressure on a piece of farm equipment.
subtasks: Referencing the equipment's manual for recommended pressure levels.
Using a tire pressure gauge to measure current pressure.
Adjusting pressure as necessary by adding or releasing air.

tasks.task: Moving livestock from one pen to another.
subtasks: Gathering the animals gently but firmly to start moving them.
Leading the animals through the appropriate gates or alleys between pens.
Ensuring all animals are accounted for upon arrival at the new pen.

tasks.task: Implementing dust control measures in a dusty agricultural area.
subtasks: Scouting areas where dust is a problem, such as roads or fields.
Sprinkling water or using misting systems to reduce dust.
Planting cover crops or trees to act as windbreaks.
Animal management practices that reduce dust, such as hoof trimming.

tasks.task: Securing a gate in the barn that is causing issues or frequent accidents.
subtasks: Analyzing why the gate is problematic, such as hinges, latch, etc.
Either repairing the existing gate or replacing it with a safer model.
Installing a new latch or improving the hardware to prevent swinging.
Testing the gate's stability and ease of use after modifications.

tasks.task: Using a pulley system to lower heavy bales from a loft or high hay stack.
subtasks: Assembling the pulley system with ropes or chains.
Properly attaching the bale to the pulley.
Employing another person to assist in manually cranking the pulley to lower the bale safely.
Checking for any snags or hazards during lowering.

tasks.task: Driving a piece of agricultural machinery, such as a loader.
subtasks: Inspecting the machine for any visible damages or maintenance requirements.
Starting the machine and performing a safety check.
Using controls to lift or move materials as needed in the field.
Staying aware of surroundings and adhering to traffic laws if on a public road.

tasks.task: Constructing an animal shelter or a feeding station.
subtasks: Measuring and cutting wood or bars for the structure's框架.
Assembling the framework with tools like a hammer, saw, or drill.
Adding roofing material and insulating if necessary.
Securing the shelter to the ground with stakes or concrete footings if permanent.

tasks.task: Planting cover crops in a field after a harvesting operation.
subtasks: Selecting appropriate cover crop seeds suitable for the area.
Using a drill or planter to seed the cover crop into the ground.
Ensuring the seeds are planted at the correct depth and spacing.
Following up with necessary weed control and watering as needed.

tasks.task: Driving a small all-terrain vehicle (ATV) for field inspections.
subtasks: Ensuring the ATV is in good working condition with proper tires and fuel.
Routinely checking on crops, livestock, or equipment across the farm.
Noting any areas needing attention and reporting back to the main operations.

tasks.task: Using a clipboard and pen to record field notes and measurements.
subtasks: Setting up at a workstation near the field or machinery.
Checking tools for writing (pen and paper or clipbord) daily.
Noting observations such as plant health, soil moisture, or equipment status.
Entering notes into a logbook or digital system when possible.

tasks.task: Moving a concrete mixing truck to different building sites on a farm.
subtasks: Checking the truck's fuel and water levels before departure.
Driving the truck to the construction location, following proper traffic rules.
Positioning the truck for mixing and loading concrete.
Ensuring the neighbor or operator has the necessary safety equipment.

tasks.task: Directing a sprinkler system to irrigate crops.
subtasks: Inspecting the irrigation system for blockages or leaks.
Programming the sprinkler controller for the desired watering schedule.
Activating the sprinklers to begin irrigation, monitoring for proper coverage.

tasks.task: Feeding young animals, such as pigs or calves, while their mothers are away.
subtasks: Providing food, water, and cleaning up after the animals.
Assigning and maintaining regular feeding schedules.
Monitoring the animals for any signs of illness or distress.

tasks.task: Using a grafting tool to perform tree grafting.
subtasks: Preparing the rootstock and scion cuttings.
Cleaning and sharpening the grafting knife.
Making precise cuts on the rootstock and scion.
Applying the graft union and cabling if needed.
Securing the union with tape or twine to prevent movement.

tasks.task: Checking the latches on a band binder to ensure they are not stuck.
subtasks: Accessing the binder on the baler.
Inspecting each latch or closing mechanism for the bands.
Lubricating moving parts with oil if necessary.
Testing the closing action to confirm unlatched bands are released properly.

tasks.task: Loading a large round baler with hay onto a trailer.
subtasks: Positioning the trailer close to the baler's loading area.
Ensuring the trailer is in a secure location, not on a slope.
Using appropriate tools like a pitchfork or bale fork to load the baler.
Properly securing the bales on the trailer to prevent rolling or shifting.

tasks.task: Moving a heavy gate to replace a damaged one in a fence.
subtasks: Lifting the new gate from storage or the workshop.
Carrying the gate to the fence location and setting it in place.
Aligning the gate with existing posts or creating new posts if needed.
Installing hinges, latches, and any required hardware.
Securing the gate with posts and ensuring it swings freely.

tasks.task: Applying a protective coating or paint to a piece of equipment.
subtasks: Cleaning the equipment to remove dirt and old paint.
Applying primer if the surface needs it.
Choosing the appropriate paint or coating based on exposure.
Applying multiple coats as needed for coverage and durability.
Allowing the paint to dry completely before use.

tasks.task: Digging a water well or borehole on the farm.
subtasks: Surveying the land to determine the best location for water.
Preparing the site for drilling by clearing vegetation and marking boundaries.
Operating the drilling rig to reach the water table.
Installing a casing and liner to prevent contamination and collapse.
Grouting and testing the well for water quality and quantity.

tasks.task: Using a rake to remove weeds and debris from a field.
subtasks: Positioning the rake behind a tractor or in hand if small.
Moving the rake through the field to cut or grip the unwanted vegetation.
Agitating the soil and weeds to loosen them.
Collector and disposal of the cut material, sometimes by turning it back into the field or moving it to a compost area.

tasks.task: Checking the tension of the main drive belt on a combine.
subtasks: Shifting the combine into first gear.
Engaging the belt guard and checking for proper belt tension between the pulleys.
Adjusting the belt tension by turning the adjusting bolt if necessary.
Confirming the adjustment by shifting back into neutral or reverse.

tasks.task: Pruning trees to maintain a shape or remove dead branches.
subtasks: Inspecting the tree for dead, diseased, or crossing branches.
Selecting the appropriate pruning tool: hand pruners, loppers, or saw.
Making clean cuts just above a bud or lateral branch.
Disposing of the pruned branches properly, either mulched or removed.

Programming the sprinkler controller for the desired watering schedule.
Activating the sprinklers to begin irrigation, monitoring for proper coverage.

tasks.task: Feeding young animals, such as pigs or calves, while their mothers are away.
subtasks: Providing food, water, and cleaning up after the animals.
Assigning and maintaining regular feeding schedules.
Monitoring the animals for any signs of illness or distress.

tasks.task: Using a grafting tool to perform tree grafting.
subtasks: Preparing the rootstock and scion cuttings.
Cleaning and sharpening the grafting knife.
Making precise cuts on the rootstock and scion.
Applying the graft union and cabling if needed.
Securing the union with tape or twine to prevent movement.

tasks.task: Checking the latches on a band binder to ensure they are not stuck.
subtasks: Accessing the binder on the baler.
Inspecting each latch or closing mechanism for the bands.

tasks.task: Checking the band on a baler to ensure it's tight, which would include comforting the latches?
Loading a large round baler with hay onto a trailer.
subtasks: Positioning the trailer close to the baler's loading area.
Ensuring the trailer is in a secure location, not on a slope.
Using appropriate tools like a pitchfork or bale fork to load the baler.
Properly securing the bales on the trailer to prevent rolling or shifting.

tasks.task: Moving a heavy gate to replace a damaged one in a fence.
subtasks: Lifting the new gate from storage or the workshop.
Carrying the gate to the fence location and setting it in place.
Aligning the gate with existing posts or creating new posts if needed.
Installing hinges, latches, and any required hardware.
Securing the gate with posts and ensuring it swings freely.

tasks.task: Applying a protective coating or paint to a piece of equipment.
subtasks: Cleaning the equipment to remove dirt and old paint.
Applying primer if the surface needs it.
Choosing the appropriate paint or coating based on exposure.
Applying multiple coats as needed for coverage and durability.
Allowing the paint to dry completely before use.

tasks.task: Digging a water well or borehole on the farm.
subtasks: Surveying the land to determine the best location for water.
Preparing the site for drilling by clearing vegetation and marking boundaries.
Operating the drilling rig to reach the water table.
Installing a casing and liner to prevent contamination and collapse.
Grouting and testing the well for water quality and quantity.

tasks.task: Using a rake to remove weeds and debris from a field.
subtasks: Positioning the rake behind a tractor or in hand if small.
Moving the rake through the field to cut or grip the unwanted vegetation.
Agitating the soil and weeds to loosen them.
Collector and disposal of the cut material, sometimes by turning it back into the field or moving it to a compost area.

tasks.task: Checking the tension of the main drive belt on a combine.
subtasks: Shifting the combine into first gear.
Engaging the belt guard and checking for proper belt tension between the pulleys.
Adjusting the belt tension by turning the adjusting bolt if necessary.
Confirming the adjustment by shifting back into neutral or reverse.

tasks.task: Pruning trees to maintain a shape or remove dead branches.
subtasks: Inspecting the tree for dead, diseased, or crossing branches.
Selecting the appropriate pruning tool: hand pruners, loppers, or saw.
Making clean cuts just above a bud or lateral branch.
Disposing of the pruned branches properly, either mulched or removed.
